docs.abstract: The senator, under fire for comments that were widely criticized, said, “For anyone that was offended by my remarks, I certainly apologize.”
docs.snippet: The senator, under fire for comments that were widely criticized, said, “For anyone that was offended by my remarks, I certainly apologize.”
docs.lead_paragraph: JACKSON, Miss. — Senator Cindy Hyde-Smith of Mississippi used a debate Tuesday to express regret for making a cavalier reference to “a public hanging,” in an attempt to steady her campaign just over a week after she imperiled her prospects against the former congressman Mike Espy in a state scarred by racial violence.

headline.main: Cindy Hyde-Smith, in Mississippi Runoff Debate, Addresses ‘Public Hanging’ Remarks

docs.abstract: The state’s voters will decide between Cindy Hyde-Smith and Mike Espy as their next senator.
docs.snippet: The state’s voters will decide between Cindy Hyde-Smith and Mike Espy as their next senator.
docs.lead_paragraph: JACKSON, Miss. — The final Senate race of the year will end on Tuesday, when Mississippi voters will settle a runoff election between Senator Cindy Hyde-Smith, a Republican, and her Democratic challenger, Mike Espy, after a campaign that called forth unsettling reminders of the state’s racist history.

headline.main: Mississippi Senate Runoff Election: Here’s What You Should Know

docs.abstract: Mr. DeSantis had strong support from President Trump, but initial missteps left him trailing his Democratic opponent. Now he is on the attack, seeking momentum.
docs.snippet: Mr. DeSantis had strong support from President Trump, but initial missteps left him trailing his Democratic opponent. Now he is on the attack, seeking momentum.
docs.lead_paragraph: TAMPA — The church gathering was a campaign event intended to boost the candidacy of Ron DeSantis, Florida’s Republican candidate for governor, but it wasn’t long before the television cameras turned to a rally outside on the street supporting Mr. DeSantis’s Democratic opponent, Andrew Gillum.

headline.main: Ron DeSantis Reboots in Close Florida Governor’s Race, After Early Stumble
headline.print_headline: After a Stumble at the Start, a Candidate Tries to Hit the Reset Button

byline.original: By Stephanie Saul, Patricia Mazzei and Jonathan Martin

docs.abstract: After the surprise victory of Mr. Gillum, a progressive, 39-year-old black man, in the Democratic primary for Florida governor, he must now find a way to raise enough money for a grueling general election.
docs.snippet: After the surprise victory of Mr. Gillum, a progressive, 39-year-old black man, in the Democratic primary for Florida governor, he must now find a way to raise enough money for a grueling general election.
docs.lead_paragraph: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. — Andrew Gillum waged a quixotic Democratic primary campaign for Florida governor, defeating wealthy rivals who outspent him, dismissing moderate naysayers who questioned him and believing until the end that an unorthodox strategy of excitement generated mostly by word of mouth would propel him to victory.

headline.main: Andrew Gillum Pulled Off the Upset of a Lifetime. Now Comes the Hard Part.
headline.print_headline: Underdog Won in Florida With Unlikely Voters

byline.original: By Patricia Mazzei and Jonathan Martin

docs.abstract: The final debate in the governor’s race suggested a hard edge to the last stretch of an intense contest in the nation’s biggest presidential swing state.
docs.snippet: The final debate in the governor’s race suggested a hard edge to the last stretch of an intense contest in the nation’s biggest presidential swing state.
docs.lead_paragraph: DAVIE, Fla. — Blistering verbal assaults overtook the race for Florida governor on Wednesday night, as rivals Andrew Gillum and Ron DeSantis presented voters with an onslaught of character insults in their final debate before the November election.

headline.main: Andrew Gillum and Ron DeSantis Trade Attacks Over Corruption and Racism in Florida Debate
headline.print_headline: Squaring Off in Florida, Candidates Trade Barbs  Over Graft and Racism

byline.original: By Patricia Mazzei and Lisa Lerer

docs.abstract: The debate was the first in Florida’s nationally watched race for governor. The rivals were evenly matched on stage.
docs.snippet: The debate was the first in Florida’s nationally watched race for governor. The rivals were evenly matched on stage.
docs.lead_paragraph: MIAMI — Ron DeSantis and Andrew Gillum delivered fiery exchanges in their first debate on Sunday night, showing a national audience why they are locked in a fierce, closely matched race to become Florida’s next governor. They differed not only on their strikingly opposite policy positions, but also on matters of personal integrity and character that have shaped the election.

headline.main: Florida Governor Candidates Andrew Gillum and Ron DeSantis Face Off in Contentious Debate

docs.abstract: Mike Espy, the Democratic nominee in the Mississippi Senate election Tuesday, has had to choose between satisfying African-Americans and white liberals or driving away conservative-leaning voters.
docs.snippet: Mike Espy, the Democratic nominee in the Mississippi Senate election Tuesday, has had to choose between satisfying African-Americans and white liberals or driving away conservative-leaning voters.
docs.lead_paragraph: JACKSON, Miss. — When Mike Espy, the Democrat challenging Senator Cindy Hyde-Smith of Mississippi, faced his opponent at a debate ahead of this Tuesday’s runoff election, he had to make a choice: confront Ms. Hyde-Smith over her comments about attending “a public hanging,” which evoked the state’s racist history, or take a milder approach to avoid alienating the conservative-leaning white voters who will most likely decide the election.

headline.main: Across South, Democrats Who Speak Boldly Risk Alienating Rural White Voters
headline.print_headline: The Southern Democrats’ White, Rural Problem

docs.abstract: At a symposium organized by Jane Sanders, the Vermont senator didn’t quite take the reins of 2020 leadership. But he didn’t drop them either.
docs.snippet: At a symposium organized by Jane Sanders, the Vermont senator didn’t quite take the reins of 2020 leadership. But he didn’t drop them either.
docs.lead_paragraph: BURLINGTON, Vt. — When Jane Sanders introduced her event’s keynote speaker here on Thursday night, she called him “my best friend” but didn’t say his name.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders Steps Out With His Favored Political Partner: His Wife

docs.abstract: Another week is ending, and winners have yet to be called in a district in California and one in New York.
docs.snippet: Another week is ending, and winners have yet to be called in a district in California and one in New York.
docs.lead_paragraph: And here you thought the midterms would be over after the special election in Mississippi on Tuesday.

headline.main: Nearly a Month After the Midterms, Some House Races Are Still Undecided

docs.abstract: With a late boost from President Trump, Ms. Hyde-Smith defeated the Democratic candidate, Mike Espy, and set the Republican advantage in the Senate at 53-47.
docs.snippet: With a late boost from President Trump, Ms. Hyde-Smith defeated the Democratic candidate, Mike Espy, and set the Republican advantage in the Senate at 53-47.
docs.lead_paragraph: JACKSON, Miss. — Senator Cindy Hyde-Smith, a Mississippi Republican who had to apologize for a cavalier reference to a public hanging, won a special runoff election on Tuesday, defeating the Democratic candidate, Mike Espy, who was trying to become the state’s first black senator since Reconstruction.

headline.main: In Electing Cindy Hyde-Smith, Mississippi Stays True to Its Conservative Roots
headline.print_headline: Senate Runoff In Mississippi  Goes to G.O.P.
